subject: Education
title: Horace Mann: The Father of Public School
description: Learn Horace Mann: The Father of Public School in one minute.

hook.text: Before Horace Mann, American schools were local, chaotic, and optional. He made education a public responsibility.

buildup.text: As Massachusetts' first education secretary in 1837, Mann pushed for free, nonsectarian, universal public schools.

discovery.text: Mann called education the 'great equalizer.' He believed public schools could break the cycle of poverty.

twist.text: His critics said he was creating government propaganda machines. The same debate rages today about public education.

climax.text: Mann's vision won. By 1918, every US state had compulsory education laws. Free school became a right.

punchline.text: Free public school seemed radical in 1837. Now it's as basic as roads.
